alert.note: Alert for Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 7:11AM EDT until August 26 at 9:45AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR WARRICK COUNTY... At 611 AM CDT, Heavy rainfall has ended but roadways remain flooded in several locations and will likely remain so for the next hour or two. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Boonville, Newburgh, Chandler, Folsomville and Tennyson. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
